since_last_update: US growth-sentiment downside shock: Conference Board Consumer Confidence printed 84.5 vs 91 expected on Jan 27, reinforcing a slower-demand narrative (LOCAL).
Late-session equity microstructure was supply-heavy: large MOC sell imbalances (S&P, Nasdaq, Mag7) flagged close-to-open volatility risk around headlines (LOCAL).

Geopolitics toggled from de-escalation optics (Saudi non-participation signal) to renewed escalation rhetoric: Trump said “time is running out” for Iran (LOCAL). Net effect: wider tail-risk distribution (risk-off impulse if rhetoric escalates further; risk-on relief if no follow-through).
Overnight global rates input: Australia CPI ran hotter than expected on some measures, adding a mild upward bias to global yields via cross-market repricing/relative-value flows (LOCAL).
Europe political tail-risk eased marginally: France government survived a no-confidence vote, trimming near-term fragmentation risk (Reuters).
today_focus: Dominant driver: FOMC day. The market is positioned for a hold, but the risk is the *reaction function* (guidance on cuts/neutral rate and how Powell frames inflation vs growth) rather than the rate decision itself (AP, Yahoo Finance).
Cross-asset tell: gold strength + USD weakness signaling elevated hedging demand and/or a reduced ‘bonds-as-hedge’ reflex; watch if this persists through the FOMC (FT).
Equity tape focus: megacap/AI-led risk appetite remains the marginal equity beta, with attention on big-tech earnings cadence and semis (Yahoo Finance, Barron’s).

Second-order but live: geopolitics (Iran rhetoric) can inject intraday vol into oil → inflation risk → rates → NQ duration sensitivity; watch for headline-driven convexity in gold and crude (LOCAL, FT).
Health care idiosyncratic risk (e.g., Medicare Advantage rate outlook) is acting as a sector drag even if index-level futures are supported by tech (AP).

policy_path.base_case_priced: Hold at this meeting; pricing sensitivity is in the wording/press conference about timing and conditionality of future cuts (AP, Yahoo Finance).
policy_path.what_would_change_pricing_fast: Any hint that the Fed is less willing to validate easing expectations (hawkish hold) would likely re-tighten financial conditions via higher real yields; a growth-concerned/dovish hold would support duration but can weaken USD and sustain gold bid.
policy_path.uncertainty: High into/through the press conference; market reaction likely driven by rate-vol and real-yield impulse rather than the statement alone.

equities.implied_regime: Index-level support appears concentrated in tech/AI leadership; breadth risk remains underpriced vs the index’s headline resilience (Barron’s, Yahoo Finance).
equities.session_setup: Event-risk day suggests higher intraday gamma/vol sensitivity; prior close-auction supply increases risk of sharp, mechanically driven swings around 2pm ET and into the close (LOCAL).

rates_usd_gold.observed_bias: Gold bid concurrent with reported USD weakness implies either higher tail-risk hedging demand or a ‘USD debasement/policy risk’ narrative dominating over real-yield headwinds (FT).
rates_usd_gold.key_level_to_watch_conceptually: If real yields rise on a hawkish hold, gold is exposed to a positioning air-pocket; if USD weakens further on policy uncertainty, gold can stay supported even without a rates rally (FT).

oil_geopolitics_link.setup: Iran-related rhetoric increases optionality premia in crude; if oil lifts, it can feed back into inflation expectations and cap duration rallies post-FOMC.
oil_geopolitics_link.uncertainty: Headline-dependent; no clear confirmation of concrete policy action from provided inputs.

risk_register.risk: FOMC communication shock: market expecting a hold; asymmetric risk is a hawkish hold (higher real yields) compressing equity duration and pressuring NQ; dovish hold could weaken USD and extend gold bid but risks ‘bad growth’ framing for cyclicals.
Geopolitical escalation premium (Iran rhetoric) resurfaces: could lift crude risk premium and raise inflation-risk tails, complicating the post-FOMC rates/equity reaction.
Mega-cap concentration/breadth fragility: index resilience masking sector drawdowns; earnings or guidance misses in a few large names can gap ES/NQ despite benign macro.
Gold positioning vulnerability: if the Fed outcome re-prices real yields higher or stabilizes USD, gold could see fast deleveraging even if geopolitical risk remains.
Late-day liquidity + auction sensitivity: prior MOC sell imbalance and event-day hedging can amplify otherwise modest headlines into outsized index moves.

event_warnings: FOMC rate decision and statement at 19:00 UTC (2:00pm ET) + Powell press conference at 19:30 UTC (2:30pm ET): expect rate-vol-driven cross-asset correlation shifts (input calendar).

EIA crude oil inventories at 15:30 UTC (10:30am ET): on Iran-sensitive tape, inventory surprises can be less important than geopolitics, but the print can still move short-dated crude and inflation expectations (input calendar).
Jan 29 13:30 UTC (8:30am ET) initial jobless claims: after weak consumer confidence, labor data has higher marginal impact on ‘growth scare’ vs ‘soft landing’ framing (input calendar, LOCAL).
Jan 30 13:30 UTC (8:30am ET) PPI: can re-price near-term inflation momentum and shift the market’s interpretation of today’s Fed messaging (input calendar).
